primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement of the believer from a state of fear and perceived distance from God to a state of security and inheritance through the invitation of a loving Father.

subject.identificatie: The Hearer/Believer (as the one who must 'come closer')
tekstueel_bewijs: let us go up to the mountain
we will walk in his paths
we ought to despise the moods and days in which we have been frightened
inherit the kingdom prepared for you
a few minutes of peace... happiness

zender.identificatie: God the Father (as the one who invites and prepares)
tekstueel_bewijs: Come, ye blessed of my Father
the Lord has provided for our needs from the morning of creation
He gives to us the perfect invitation
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Subject who is invited to move toward the Receiver role.

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (as the one who reveals the Father's character)
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus does not support this idea
Jesus is saying that God is willing
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Sender and Helper (through Jesus), though the Hearer remains the active Subject of the 'coming'.

tegenstander.identificatie: Fear and False Concepts of God (Greek thought/Legalism)
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The primary obstacle is not Sin or Death as cosmic powers, but the hearer's own fear and misunderstanding of God's nature.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical life of the believer in the world (walking the path).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Walking in His paths/Not lying or scheming
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon argues that because the inheritance is already prepared, the believer no longer needs to 'scheme' or 'lie' to get ahead.

voorbeelden_god_subject: He will teach us his ways
God gives to us the perfect invitation
The Lord has provided for our needs
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we will walk in his paths
we ought to despise the moods

voorbeelden: we ought to despise the moods
we all had better take full notice

Jesus recognized that at its heart, life has a kindness
Many people think of God as a harsh... figure

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on changing the hearer's 'Knowing' (Savoir) about God's character to stimulate a 'Willing' (Vouloir) to approach Him.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Sinai/Greek myths) through ~S1 (the futility of scheming) to S1 (the Father's smile) and finally ~S2 (the security of the inheritance).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by subordinating 'Awe' to 'Kindness', suggesting that fear is a result of distance, not God's essence.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; the sermon mentions 'everlasting fire' but quickly pivots to 'infinite tenderness'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the hearer is often the subject of 'coming', the engine of the sermon is the unconditional nature of the 'Inheritance' and the 'Prepared' kingdom. It rejects human performance (scheming/muscles) in favor of receiving.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Subject-switch to hearer for the action of 'coming'
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Let us go up... we will walk

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: no man can flex his muscles and gain God's favor

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the primary actor in preparation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord has provided for our needs from the morning of creation

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Abraham and Muhammad are used as models of trust/awareness of God's presence.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on God as the one who speaks to Abraham and the Father who runs to the Son.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is grounded in the character of God (Ontology) rather than the transaction of the cross (though Christ is the messenger).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is highly coherent, consistently contrasting 'effort/fear' with 'inheritance/love'.
spanning_punten: The mention of 'sheep and goats divided by their own deeds' creates a brief actantial conflict with the 'inheritance' theme.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus saw everywhere signs of a tender, willing hand of love outstretched

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon relies on the 'Invitation' itself to provide the power to come.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed primarily as a barrier of fear and 'scheming' rather than a total ontological death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Sender and Preparer, making the 'Object' (Kingdom) an 'Inheritance' rather than a 'Reward'.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer is occasionally the subject of 'overcoming' their own fear.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The hearer as the one being 'drawn' or 'carried'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Use more passive verbs for the hearer's movement toward God.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize how the Holy Spirit enables the 'coming' when the hearer is paralyzed by fear.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Address the 'Opponent' of Sin as a power that God has defeated, not just a misunderstanding.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To prevent the grace from feeling 'sentimental' or 'cheap'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The hierarchy is correct: God prepares (Soteriology), therefore we walk (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A beautiful example of theocentric preaching that grounds human security in the eternal character and 'pre-preparation' of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'mountain' and 'altar' metaphors; Greimas shows that the 'altar' is actually the Object of a movement from Fear to Security.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the context of Isaiah 2; semiotics reveals the sermon's underlying 'Inheritance' logic from Matthew 25.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch' where God replaces 'Luck' or 'Effort' as the provider of the path.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (rules, bids, loves, gives, prepares, provides, leads)
We (bow, remember, live, walk, scheme, fear)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Parent-Child' actantial framework to collapse the distance between Sender and Receiver.
